metadata.description: Meet Jane Day. Twenty-something temp-by-day, detective-by-night. Jane is employed by M.W. Investigations, which operates out of the owner, Margaret “Peggy” Woodward’s suburban home, and is entirely staffed by women. Under the guise of a knitting club called the “Stitch & Bitch,” Peggy’s girls meet once a week. The other P.I.‘s are assigned run-of-the-mill cases: insurance fraud, infidelity, nanny watching-- the usual. Jane’s cases, though? They’re a little... different. THIS ISSUE: "SOMNOLOGY 101: THE SCIENCE OF SLEEPWALKING" - Jane works the day shift at Lindelof & Lindelof and the night shift recording the things that go bump in the night. Specifically, the thing called Brett Wegener, sleepwalker extraordinaire. She also gets acquainted with her very own stalker. Pie and Cake also pop by for a visit.
metadata.name: P.I. Jane
